org.grouplens.grapht

Interface Injector

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultInjector

    public interface Injector

    Injector uses dependency injection to act as a factory for creating instances with complex dependencies. A default implementation of Injector can easily be created by using an InjectorBuilder: 

     InjectorBuilder b = new InjectorBuilder();
 b.bind(Foo.class).to(Bar.class);
 b.applyModule(new MyCustomModule());
 // other bindings
 Injector i = b.build();
 assert (i.getInstance(Foo.class) instanceof Bar);

    Alternatively, BindingFunctionBuilder and DependencySolver can be used to create your own Injector implementations.

    Author:
    GroupLens Research

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        <T> T getInstance(Class<T> type)
              throws InjectionException

        Get an instance of T based on the bindings that this Injector was configured with. An exception is thrown if the request type cannot be instantiated with dependency injection.

        Injectors may memoize or cache previously created objects. As an example, the Injector created by InjectorBuilder reuses instances where possible.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The object type being created
        Parameters:
        type - The class type
        Returns:
        An instance of type T
        Throws:
        ConstructionException - if type cannot be instantiated
        InjectionException

      • getInstance

        <T> T getInstance(Annotation qualifier,
                Class<T> type)
              throws ConstructionException,
                     InjectionException

        Get an instance of T with the given Qualifier annotation.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The object type
        Parameters:
        qualifier - The qualifier on of the returned instance
        type - The class type
        Returns:
        An instance of type T
        Throws:
        ConstructionException - if type cannot be instantiated
        InjectionException
